thread.title: Pantochino opens season with family musical ‘Dractastic!’ in Milford
thread.title_full: Pantochino opens season with family musical ‘Dractastic!’ in Milford

title: Pantochino opens season with family musical ‘Dractastic!’ in Milford
text:
Jimmy Johansmeyer plays a clever and very funny Dracula in Pantochino's new musical, “Dractastic.” Jimmy Johansmeyer plays a clever and very funny Dracula in Pantochino's new musical, “Dractastic.” Photo: Contributed Photo Pantochino opens season with family musical ‘Dractastic!’ in Milford 1 / 1 Back to Gallery 
Pantochino Productions Inc. launches its new season with the new musical comedy, “Dractastic!” The nonprofit professional theater company for family audiences will present the show on Friday, Oct. 23, through Sunday, Nov. 1, at the Center for the Arts in Milford. 
“Dractastic!” is a comical retelling of the vampire legend set in the world of rock music. In this original version by Bert Bernardi and Justin Rugg , “Drac“ is a rock star who woos fans with his captivating music and songs. 
“We’ve created the perfect Halloween season musical, filled with lots of gags and laughs for audiences of all ages to enjoy,” said Bernardi, in a news release on the show. “Jimmy Johansmeyer is the most clever, funniest Dracula you’ll ever see.” 
Joining Johansmeyer onstage are Mary Mannix , Shelley Marsh Poggio , Jeremy Tortora , Andrea Pane, George Spelvin , Rugg and Katie Harris . “Dractastic” will feature sets by Von Del Mar, lighting by Jeff Carr and costumes by Johansmeyer. The stage manager is Jeff Therklesen. 
New this season, Pantochino will offer “party performances” at its 2 p.m. shows on Saturdays. Audiences will be seated at tables and are invited to bring their own food and drink to be enjoyed during the performance. 
Milford Center for the Arts , 40 Railroad Ave. S. (eastbound side of Metro-North tracks). Friday, Oct. 23-Sunday, Nov. 1. Fridays 7:30 p.m.; Saturdays, Sundays 2 p.m. Additional show Saturday, Oct. 24, 5:30 p.m. $20 at door, $18 online, $20 at door. Advance purchases suggested. Free parking in train station lots. pantochino.com
